get.description: Assign a registered instance to a layer.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The instance ID.

parameters.name: LayerIds
parameters.description: The layer ID, which must correspond to a custom layer. You cannot assign a registered instance to a built-in layer.

get.description: Assigns one of the stacks registered Amazon EBS volumes to a specified instance.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The instance ID.

parameters.name: VolumeId
parameters.description: The volume ID.

get.description: Associates one of the stacks registered Elastic IP addresses with a specified instance.

parameters.name: ElasticIp
parameters.description: The Elastic IP address.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The instance ID.

get.description: Attaches an Elastic Load Balancing load balancer to a specified layer.

parameters.name: ElasticLoadBalancerName
parameters.description: The Elastic Load Balancing instances name.

parameters.name: LayerId
parameters.description: The ID of the layer that the Elastic Load Balancing instance is to be attached to.

get.description: Creates a clone of a specified stack.

parameters.name: AgentVersion
parameters.description: The default AWS OpsWorks Stacks agent version. You have the following options:

parameters.name: Attributes
parameters.description: A list of stack attributes and values as key/value pairs to be added to the cloned stack.

parameters.name: ChefConfiguration
parameters.description: A ChefConfiguration object that specifies whether to enable Berkshelf and the      Berkshelf version on Chef 11.10 stacks. For more information, see Create a New Stack.

parameters.name: CloneAppIds
parameters.description: A list of source stack app IDs to be included in the cloned stack.

parameters.name: ClonePermissions
parameters.description: Whether to clone the source stacks permissions.

parameters.name: ConfigurationManager
parameters.description: The configuration manager. When you clone a stack we recommend that you use the configuration manager to specify the Chef version: 12, 11.10, or 11.4 for Linux stacks, or 12.2 for Windows stacks. The default value for Linux stacks is currently 12.

parameters.name: CustomCookbooksSource
parameters.description: Contains the information required to retrieve an app or cookbook from a repository. For more      information, see Creating Apps or Custom Recipes and        Cookbooks.

parameters.name: CustomJson
parameters.description: A string that contains user-defined, custom JSON. It is used to override the corresponding default stack configuration JSON values. The string should be in the following format:

parameters.name: DefaultAvailabilityZone
parameters.description: The cloned stacks default Availability Zone, which must be in the specified region. For more      information, see Regions and        Endpoints. If you also specify a value for DefaultSubnetId, the subnet must      be in the same zone. For more information, see the VpcId parameter description.

parameters.name: DefaultInstanceProfileArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM profile that is the default profile for all of the stacks EC2 instances.      For more information about IAM ARNs, see Using      Identifiers.

parameters.name: DefaultOs
parameters.description: The stacks operating system, which must be set to one of the following.

parameters.name: DefaultRootDeviceType
parameters.description: The default root device type. This value is used by default for all instances in the cloned      stack, but you can override it when you create an instance. For more information, see Storage for the Root Device.

parameters.name: DefaultSshKeyName
parameters.description: A default Amazon EC2 key pair name. The default value is none. If you specify a key pair name, AWS      OpsWorks installs the public key on the instance and you can use the private key with an SSH      client to log in to the instance. For more information, see  Using SSH to        Communicate with an Instance and  Managing SSH        Access. You can override this setting by specifying a different key pair, or no key      pair, when you         create an instance.

parameters.name: DefaultSubnetId
parameters.description: The stacks default VPC subnet ID. This parameter is required if you specify a value for the        VpcId parameter. All instances are launched into this subnet unless you specify      otherwise when you create the instance. If you also specify a value for        DefaultAvailabilityZone, the subnet must be in that zone. For information on      default values and when this parameter is required, see the VpcId parameter      description.

parameters.name: HostnameTheme
parameters.description: The stacks host name theme, with spaces are replaced by underscores. The theme is used to      generate host names for the stacks instances. By default, HostnameTheme is set      to Layer_Dependent, which creates host names by appending integers to the layers      short name. The other themes are:

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The cloned stack name.

parameters.name: Region
parameters.description: The cloned stack AWS region, such as ap-northeast-2. For more information about AWS regions, see        Regions and Endpoints.

parameters.name: ServiceRoleArn
parameters.description: The stack AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role, which allows AWS OpsWorks Stacks to work with AWS      resources on your behalf. You must set this parameter to the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an      existing IAM role. If you create a stack by using the AWS OpsWorks Stacks console, it creates the role for      you. You can obtain an existing stacks IAM ARN programmatically by calling        DescribePermissions. For more information about IAM ARNs, see Using      Identifiers.

parameters.name: SourceStackId
parameters.description: The source stack ID.

parameters.name: UseCustomCookbooks
parameters.description: Whether to use custom cookbooks.

parameters.name: UseOpsworksSecurityGroups
parameters.description: Whether to associate the AWS OpsWorks Stacks built-in security groups with the stacks layers.

parameters.name: VpcId
parameters.description: The ID of the VPC that the cloned stack is to be launched into. It must be in the specified region. All          instances are launched into this VPC, and you cannot change the ID later.

get.description: Creates an app for a specified stack.

parameters.name: AppSource
parameters.description: A Source object that specifies the app repository.

parameters.name: Attributes
parameters.description: One or more user-defined key/value pairs to be added to the stack attributes.

parameters.name: DataSources
parameters.description: The apps data source.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: A description of the app.

parameters.name: Domains
parameters.description: The app virtual host settings, with multiple domains separated by commas. For example:        www.example.com, example.com

parameters.name: EnableSsl
parameters.description: Whether to enable SSL for the app.

parameters.name: Environment
parameters.description: An array of EnvironmentVariable objects that specify environment variables to be      associated with the app. After you deploy the app, these variables are defined on the      associated app server instance. For more information, see  Environment Variables.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The app name.

parameters.name: Shortname
parameters.description: The apps short name.

parameters.name: SslConfiguration
parameters.description: An SslConfiguration object with the SSL configuration.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The stack ID.

parameters.name: Type
parameters.description: The app type. Each supported type is associated with a particular layer. For example, PHP      applications are associated with a PHP layer. AWS OpsWorks Stacks deploys an application to those instances      that are members of the corresponding layer. If your app isnt one of the standard types, or      you prefer to implement your own Deploy recipes, specify other.

get.description: Runs deployment or stack commands.

parameters.name: AppId
parameters.description: The app ID. This parameter is required for app deployments, but not for other deployment commands.

parameters.name: Command
parameters.description: A DeploymentCommand object that specifies the deployment command and any      associated arguments.

parameters.name: Comment
parameters.description: A user-defined comment.

parameters.name: CustomJson
parameters.description: A string that contains user-defined, custom JSON. It is used to override the corresponding default stack configuration JSON values. The string should be in the following format:

parameters.name: InstanceIds
parameters.description: The instance IDs for the deployment targets.

parameters.name: LayerIds
parameters.description: The layer IDs for the deployment targets.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The stack ID.

get.description: Creates an instance in a specified stack.

parameters.name: AgentVersion
parameters.description: The default AWS OpsWorks Stacks agent version. You have the following options:

parameters.name: AmiId
parameters.description: A custom AMI ID to be used to create the instance. The AMI should be based on one of the      supported operating systems.      For more information, see      Using Custom AMIs.

parameters.name: Architecture
parameters.description: The instance architecture. The default option is x86_64. Instance types do not      necessarily support both architectures. For a list of the architectures that are supported by      the different instance types, see Instance Families and        Types.

parameters.name: AutoScalingType
parameters.description: For load-based or time-based instances, the type. Windows stacks can use only time-based instances.

parameters.name: AvailabilityZone
parameters.description: The instance Availability Zone. For more information, see Regions and Endpoints.

parameters.name: BlockDeviceMappings
parameters.description: An array of BlockDeviceMapping objects that specify the instances block      devices. For more information, see Block        Device Mapping. Note that block device mappings are not supported for custom AMIs.

parameters.name: EbsOptimized
parameters.description: Whether to create an Amazon EBS-optimized instance.

parameters.name: Hostname
parameters.description: The instance host name.

parameters.name: InstallUpdatesOnBoot
parameters.description: Whether to install operating system and package updates when the instance boots. The default      value is true. To control when updates are installed, set this value to        false. You must then update your instances manually by using        CreateDeployment to run the update_dependencies stack command or      by manually running yum (Amazon Linux) or apt-get (Ubuntu) on the      instances.

parameters.name: InstanceType
parameters.description: The instance type, such as t2.micro. For a list of supported instance types,      open the stack in the console, choose Instances, and choose + Instance.      The Size list contains the currently supported types. For more information, see Instance        Families and Types. The parameter values that you use to specify the various types are      in the API Name column of the Available Instance Types table.

parameters.name: LayerIds
parameters.description: An array that contains the instances layer IDs.

parameters.name: Os
parameters.description: The instances operating system, which must be set to one of the following.

parameters.name: RootDeviceType
parameters.description: The instance root device type. For more information, see Storage for the Root Device.

parameters.name: SshKeyName
parameters.description: The instances Amazon EC2 key-pair name.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The stack ID.

parameters.name: SubnetId
parameters.description: The ID of the instances subnet. If the stack is running in a VPC, you can use this parameter to override the stacks default subnet ID value and direct AWS OpsWorks Stacks to launch the instance in a different subnet.

parameters.name: Tenancy
parameters.description: The instances tenancy option. The default option is no tenancy, or if the instance is running in a VPC, inherit tenancy settings from the VPC. The following are valid values for this parameter:  dedicated, default, or host. Because there are costs associated with changes in tenancy options, we recommend that you research tenancy options before choosing them for your instances. For more information about dedicated hosts, see Dedicated Hosts Overview and Amazon EC2 Dedicated Hosts. For more information about dedicated instances, see Dedicated Instances and Amazon EC2 Dedicated Instances.

parameters.name: VirtualizationType
parameters.description: The instances virtualization type, paravirtual or hvm.

get.description: Creates a layer.

parameters.name: Attributes
parameters.description: One or more user-defined key-value pairs to be added to the stack attributes.

parameters.name: AutoAssignElasticIps
parameters.description: Whether to automatically assign an Elastic IP        address to the layers instances. For more information, see How to Edit        a Layer.

parameters.name: AutoAssignPublicIps
parameters.description: For stacks that are running in a VPC, whether to automatically assign a public IP address to      the layers instances. For more information, see How to Edit        a Layer.

parameters.name: CustomInstanceProfileArn
parameters.description: The ARN of an IAM profile to be used for the layers EC2 instances. For more information      about IAM ARNs, see Using Identifiers.

parameters.name: CustomJson
parameters.description: A JSON-formatted string containing custom stack configuration and deployment attributes     to be installed on the layers instances. For more information, see              Using Custom JSON. This feature is supported as of version 1.7.42 of the AWS CLI.

parameters.name: CustomRecipes
parameters.description: A LayerCustomRecipes object that specifies the layer custom recipes.

parameters.name: CustomSecurityGroupIds
parameters.description: An array containing the layer custom security group IDs.

parameters.name: EnableAutoHealing
parameters.description: Whether to disable auto healing for the layer.

parameters.name: InstallUpdatesOnBoot
parameters.description: Whether to install operating system and package updates when the instance boots. The default      value is true. To control when updates are installed, set this value to        false. You must then update your instances manually by using        CreateDeployment to run the update_dependencies stack command or      by manually running yum (Amazon Linux) or apt-get (Ubuntu) on the      instances.

parameters.name: LifecycleEventConfiguration
parameters.description: A LifeCycleEventConfiguration object that you can use to configure the Shutdown event to      specify an execution timeout and enable or disable Elastic Load Balancer connection      draining.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The layer name, which is used by the console.

parameters.name: Packages
parameters.description: An array of Package objects that describes the layer packages.

parameters.name: Shortname
parameters.description: For custom layers only, use this parameter to specify the layers short name, which is used internally by AWS OpsWorks Stacks and by Chef recipes. The short name is also used as the name for the directory where your app files are installed. It can have a maximum of 200 characters, which are limited to the alphanumeric characters, -, _, and ..

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The layer stack ID.

parameters.name: Type
parameters.description: The layer type. A stack cannot have more than one built-in layer of the same type. It can have any number of custom layers. Built-in layers are not available in Chef 12 stacks.

parameters.name: UseEbsOptimizedInstances
parameters.description: Whether to use Amazon EBS-optimized instances.

parameters.name: VolumeConfigurations
parameters.description: A VolumeConfigurations object that describes the layers Amazon EBS volumes.

get.description: Creates a new stack.

parameters.name: AgentVersion
parameters.description: The default AWS OpsWorks Stacks agent version. You have the following options:

parameters.name: Attributes
parameters.description: One or more user-defined key-value pairs to be added to the stack attributes.

parameters.name: ChefConfiguration
parameters.description: A ChefConfiguration object that specifies whether to enable Berkshelf and the      Berkshelf version on Chef 11.10 stacks. For more information, see Create a New Stack.

parameters.name: ConfigurationManager
parameters.description: The configuration manager. When you create a stack we recommend that you use the configuration manager to specify the Chef version: 12, 11.10, or 11.4 for Linux stacks, or 12.2 for Windows stacks. The default value for Linux stacks is currently 11.4.

parameters.name: CustomCookbooksSource
parameters.description: Contains the information required to retrieve an app or cookbook from a repository. For more      information, see Creating Apps or Custom Recipes and        Cookbooks.

parameters.name: CustomJson
parameters.description: A string that contains user-defined, custom JSON. It can be used to override the corresponding default stack configuration attribute values or to pass data to recipes. The string should be in the following format:

parameters.name: DefaultAvailabilityZone
parameters.description: The stacks default Availability Zone, which must be in the specified region. For more      information, see Regions and        Endpoints. If you also specify a value for DefaultSubnetId, the subnet must      be in the same zone. For more information, see the VpcId parameter description.

parameters.name: DefaultInstanceProfileArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM profile that is the default profile for all of the stacks EC2 instances.      For more information about IAM ARNs, see Using      Identifiers.

parameters.name: DefaultOs
parameters.description: The stacks default operating system, which is installed on every instance unless you specify a different operating system when you create the instance. You can specify one of the following.

parameters.name: DefaultRootDeviceType
parameters.description: The default root device type. This value is the default for all instances in the stack,      but you can override it when you create an instance. The default option is        instance-store. For more information, see Storage for the Root Device.

parameters.name: DefaultSshKeyName
parameters.description: A default Amazon EC2 key pair name. The default value is none. If you specify a key pair name, AWS      OpsWorks installs the public key on the instance and you can use the private key with an SSH      client to log in to the instance. For more information, see  Using SSH to        Communicate with an Instance and  Managing SSH        Access. You can override this setting by specifying a different key pair, or no key      pair, when you         create an instance.

parameters.name: DefaultSubnetId
parameters.description: The stacks default VPC subnet ID. This parameter is required if you specify a value for the        VpcId parameter. All instances are launched into this subnet unless you specify      otherwise when you create the instance. If you also specify a value for        DefaultAvailabilityZone, the subnet must be in that zone. For information on      default values and when this parameter is required, see the VpcId parameter      description.

parameters.name: HostnameTheme
parameters.description: The stacks host name theme, with spaces replaced by underscores. The theme is used to      generate host names for the stacks instances. By default, HostnameTheme is set      to Layer_Dependent, which creates host names by appending integers to the layers      short name. The other themes are:

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The stack name.

parameters.name: Region
parameters.description: The stacks AWS region, such as ap-south-1. For more information about Amazon regions, see Regions and Endpoints.

parameters.name: ServiceRoleArn
parameters.description: The stacks AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role, which allows AWS OpsWorks Stacks to work with AWS      resources on your behalf. You must set this parameter to the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an      existing IAM role. For more information about IAM ARNs, see Using      Identifiers.

parameters.name: UseCustomCookbooks
parameters.description: Whether the stack uses custom cookbooks.

parameters.name: UseOpsworksSecurityGroups
parameters.description: Whether to associate the AWS OpsWorks Stacks built-in security groups with the stacks layers.

parameters.name: VpcId
parameters.description: The ID of the VPC that the stack is to be launched into. The VPC must be in the stacks region. All instances are launched into this VPC. You cannot change the ID later.

get.description: Creates a new user profile.

parameters.name: AllowSelfManagement
parameters.description: Whether users can specify their own SSH public key through the My Settings page. For more      information, see Setting an IAM        Users Public SSH Key.

parameters.name: IamUserArn
parameters.description: The users IAM ARN; this can also be a federated users ARN.

parameters.name: SshPublicKey
parameters.description: The users public SSH key.

parameters.name: SshUsername
parameters.description: The users SSH user name. The allowable characters are [a-z], [A-Z], [0-9], -, and _. If      the specified name includes other punctuation marks, AWS OpsWorks Stacks removes them. For example,        my.name will be changed to myname. If you do not specify an SSH      user name, AWS OpsWorks Stacks generates one from the IAM user name.

get.description: Deletes a specified app.

parameters.name: AppId
parameters.description: The app ID.

get.description: Deletes a specified instance, which terminates the associated Amazon EC2 instance.

parameters.name: DeleteElasticIp
parameters.description: Whether to delete the instance Elastic IP address.

parameters.name: DeleteVolumes
parameters.description: Whether to delete the instances Amazon EBS volumes.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The instance ID.

get.description: Deletes a specified layer.

parameters.name: LayerId
parameters.description: The layer ID.

get.description: Deletes a specified stack.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The stack ID.

get.description: Deletes a user profile.

parameters.name: IamUserArn
parameters.description: The users IAM ARN. This can also be a federated users ARN.

get.description: Deregisters a specified Amazon ECS cluster from a stack.

parameters.name: EcsClusterArn
parameters.description: The clusters ARN.

get.description: Deregisters a specified Elastic IP address.

parameters.name: ElasticIp
parameters.description: The Elastic IP address.

get.description: Deregister a registered Amazon EC2 or on-premises instance.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The instance ID.

get.description: Deregisters an Amazon RDS instance.

parameters.name: RdsDbInstanceArn
parameters.description: The Amazon RDS instances ARN.

get.description: Deregisters an Amazon EBS volume.

parameters.name: VolumeId
parameters.description: The AWS OpsWorks Stacks volume ID, which is the GUID that AWS OpsWorks Stacks assigned to the instance when you registered the volume with the stack, not the Amazon EC2 volume ID.

get.description: Describes the available AWS OpsWorks Stacks agent versions.

parameters.name: ConfigurationManager
parameters.description: The configuration manager.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The stack ID.

get.description: Requests a description of a specified set of apps.

parameters.name: AppIds
parameters.description: An array of app IDs for the apps to be described. If you use this parameter,        DescribeApps returns a description of the specified apps. Otherwise, it returns      a description of every app.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The app stack ID. If you use this parameter, DescribeApps returns a description      of the apps in the specified stack.

get.description: Describes the results of specified commands.

parameters.name: CommandIds
parameters.description: An array of command IDs. If you include this parameter, DescribeCommands returns      a description of the specified commands. Otherwise, it returns a description of every      command.

parameters.name: DeploymentId
parameters.description: The deployment ID. If you include this parameter, DescribeCommands returns a      description of the commands associated with the specified deployment.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The instance ID. If you include this parameter, DescribeCommands returns a      description of the commands associated with the specified instance.

get.description: Requests a description of a specified set of deployments.

parameters.name: AppId
parameters.description: The app ID. If you include this parameter, DescribeDeployments returns a      description of the commands associated with the specified app.

parameters.name: DeploymentIds
parameters.description: An array of deployment IDs to be described. If you include this parameter,        DescribeDeployments returns a description of the specified deployments.      Otherwise, it returns a description of every deployment.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The stack ID. If you include this parameter, DescribeDeployments returns a      description of the commands associated with the specified stack.

get.description: Describes Amazon ECS clusters that are registered with a stack.

parameters.name: EcsClusterArns
parameters.description: A list of ARNs, one for each cluster to be described.

parameters.name: MaxResults
parameters.description: To receive a paginated response, use this parameter to specify the maximum number      of results to be returned with a single call. If the number of available results exceeds this maximum, the      response includes a NextToken value that you can assign      to the NextToken request parameter to get the next set of results.

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: If the previous paginated request did not return all of the remaining results,      the response objectsNextToken parameter value is set to a token.      To retrieve the next set of results, call DescribeEcsClusters      again and assign that token to the request objects NextToken parameter.      If there are no remaining results, the previous response      objects NextToken parameter is set to null.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: A stack ID.      DescribeEcsClusters returns a description of the cluster that is registered with the stack.

get.description: Describes Elastic IPs

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The instance ID. If you include this parameter, DescribeElasticIps returns a      description of the Elastic IP addresses associated with the specified instance.

parameters.name: Ips
parameters.description: An array of Elastic IP addresses to be described. If you include this parameter,        DescribeElasticIps returns a description of the specified Elastic IP addresses.      Otherwise, it returns a description of every Elastic IP address.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: A stack ID. If you include this parameter, DescribeElasticIps returns a      description of the Elastic IP addresses that are registered with the specified stack.

get.description: Describes a stacks Elastic Load Balancing instances.

parameters.name: LayerIds
parameters.description: A list of layer IDs. The action describes the Elastic Load Balancing instances for the specified layers.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: A stack ID. The action describes the stacks Elastic Load Balancing instances.

get.description: Requests a description of a set of instances.

parameters.name: InstanceIds
parameters.description: An array of instance IDs to be described. If you use this parameter,        DescribeInstances returns a description of the specified instances. Otherwise,      it returns a description of every instance.

parameters.name: LayerId
parameters.description: A layer ID. If you use this parameter, DescribeInstances returns descriptions of      the instances associated with the specified layer.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: A stack ID. If you use this parameter, DescribeInstances returns descriptions of      the instances associated with the specified stack.

get.description: Requests a description of one or more layers in a specified stack.

parameters.name: LayerIds
parameters.description: An array of layer IDs that specify the layers to be described. If you omit this parameter,        DescribeLayers returns a description of every layer in the specified stack.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The stack ID.

get.description: Describes load-based auto scaling configurations for specified layers.

parameters.name: LayerIds
parameters.description: An array of layer IDs.

get.description: Describes a users SSH information.

parameters.name: UserProfile
parameters.description: A UserProfile object that describes the users SSH information.

get.description: Describes the permissions for a specified stack.

parameters.name: IamUserArn
parameters.description: The users IAM ARN. This can also be a federated users ARN. For more information about IAM ARNs, see Using      Identifiers.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The stack ID.

get.description: Describe an instances RAID arrays.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The instance ID. If you use this parameter, DescribeRaidArrays returns      descriptions of the RAID arrays associated with the specified instance.

parameters.name: RaidArrayIds
parameters.description: An array of RAID array IDs. If you use this parameter, DescribeRaidArrays      returns descriptions of the specified arrays. Otherwise, it returns a description of every      array.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The stack ID.

get.description: Describes Amazon RDS instances.

parameters.name: RdsDbInstanceArns
parameters.description: An array containing the ARNs of the instances to be described.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The stack ID that the instances are registered with. The operation returns descriptions of all registered Amazon RDS instances.

get.description: Describes AWS OpsWorks Stacks service errors.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The instance ID. If you use this parameter, DescribeServiceErrors returns      descriptions of the errors associated with the specified instance.

parameters.name: ServiceErrorIds
parameters.description: An array of service error IDs. If you use this parameter, DescribeServiceErrors      returns descriptions of the specified errors. Otherwise, it returns a description of every      error.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The stack ID. If you use this parameter, DescribeServiceErrors returns      descriptions of the errors associated with the specified stack.

get.description: Requests a description of a stacks provisioning parameters.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The stack ID

get.description: Requests a description of one or more stacks.

parameters.name: StackIds
parameters.description: An array of stack IDs that specify the stacks to be described. If you omit this parameter,        DescribeStacks returns a description of every stack.

get.description: Describes the number of layers and apps in a specified stack, and the number of instances in      each state, such as running_setup or online.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The stack ID.

get.description: Describes time-based auto scaling configurations for specified instances.

parameters.name: InstanceIds
parameters.description: An array of instance IDs.

get.description: Describe specified users.

parameters.name: IamUserArns
parameters.description: An array of IAM or federated user ARNs that identify the users to be described.

get.description: Describes an instances Amazon EBS volumes.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The instance ID. If you use this parameter, DescribeVolumes returns descriptions      of the volumes associated with the specified instance.

parameters.name: RaidArrayId
parameters.description: The RAID array ID. If you use this parameter, DescribeVolumes returns      descriptions of the volumes associated with the specified RAID array.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: A stack ID. The action describes the stacks registered Amazon EBS volumes.

parameters.name: VolumeIds
parameters.description: Am array of volume IDs. If you use this parameter, DescribeVolumes returns      descriptions of the specified volumes. Otherwise, it returns a description of every      volume.

get.description: Detaches a specified Elastic Load Balancing instance from its layer.

parameters.name: ElasticLoadBalancerName
parameters.description: The Elastic Load Balancing instances name.

parameters.name: LayerId
parameters.description: The ID of the layer that the Elastic Load Balancing instance is attached to.

get.description: Disassociates an Elastic IP address from its instance.

parameters.name: ElasticIp
parameters.description: The Elastic IP address.

get.description: Gets a generated host name for the specified layer, based on the current host name theme.

parameters.name: LayerId
parameters.description: The layer ID.

get.description: NoteThis action can be used only with Windows stacks.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The instances AWS OpsWorks Stacks ID.

parameters.name: ValidForInMinutes
parameters.description: The length of time (in minutes) that the grant is valid. When the grant expires at the end of this period, the user will no longer be able to use the credentials to log in. If the user is logged in at the time, he or she automatically will be logged out.

get.description: Reboots a specified instance.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The instance ID.

get.description: Registers a specified Amazon ECS cluster with a stack.

parameters.name: EcsClusterArn
parameters.description: The clusters ARN.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The stack ID.

get.description: Registers an Elastic IP address with a specified stack.

parameters.name: ElasticIp
parameters.description: The Elastic IP address.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The stack ID.

get.description: Registers instances that were created outside of AWS OpsWorks Stacks with a specified stack.

parameters.name: Hostname
parameters.description: The instances hostname.

parameters.name: InstanceIdentity
parameters.description: An InstanceIdentity object that contains the instances identity.

parameters.name: PrivateIp
parameters.description: The instances private IP address.

parameters.name: PublicIp
parameters.description: The instances public IP address.

parameters.name: RsaPublicKey
parameters.description: The instances public RSA key. This key is used to encrypt communication between the instance and the service.

parameters.name: RsaPublicKeyFingerprint
parameters.description: The instances public RSA key fingerprint.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The ID of the stack that the instance is to be registered with.

get.description: Registers an Amazon RDS instance with a stack.

parameters.name: DbPassword
parameters.description: The database password.

parameters.name: DbUser
parameters.description: The databases master user name.

parameters.name: RdsDbInstanceArn
parameters.description: The Amazon RDS instances ARN.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The stack ID.

get.description: Registers an Amazon EBS volume with a specified stack.

parameters.name: Ec2VolumeId
parameters.description: The Amazon EBS volume ID.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The stack ID.

get.description: Specify the load-based auto scaling configuration for a specified layer.

parameters.name: DownScaling
parameters.description: An AutoScalingThresholds object with the downscaling threshold configuration. If      the load falls below these thresholds for a specified amount of time, AWS OpsWorks Stacks stops a specified      number of instances.

parameters.name: Enable
parameters.description: Enables load-based auto scaling for the layer.

parameters.name: LayerId
parameters.description: The layer ID.

parameters.name: UpScaling
parameters.description: An AutoScalingThresholds object with the upscaling threshold configuration. If      the load exceeds these thresholds for a specified amount of time, AWS OpsWorks Stacks starts a specified      number of instances.

get.description: Specifies a users permissions.

parameters.name: AllowSsh
parameters.description: The user is allowed to use SSH to communicate with the instance.

parameters.name: AllowSudo
parameters.description: The user is allowed to use sudo to elevate privileges.

parameters.name: IamUserArn
parameters.description: The users IAM ARN. This can also be a federated users ARN.

parameters.name: Level
parameters.description: The users permission level, which must be set to one of the following strings. You cannot set your own permissions level.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The stack ID.

get.description: Specify the time-based auto scaling configuration for a specified instance.

parameters.name: AutoScalingSchedule
parameters.description: An AutoScalingSchedule with the instance schedule.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The instance ID.

get.description: Starts a specified instance.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The instance ID.

get.description: Starts a stacks instances.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The stack ID.

get.description: Stops a specified instance.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The instance ID.

get.description: Stops a specified stack.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The stack ID.

get.description: Unassigns a registered instance from all of its layers.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The instance ID.

get.description: Unassigns an assigned Amazon EBS volume.

parameters.name: VolumeId
parameters.description: The volume ID.

get.description: Updates a specified app.

parameters.name: AppId
parameters.description: The app ID.

parameters.name: AppSource
parameters.description: A Source object that specifies the app repository.

parameters.name: Attributes
parameters.description: One or more user-defined key/value pairs to be added to the stack attributes.

parameters.name: DataSources
parameters.description: The apps data sources.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: A description of the app.

parameters.name: Domains
parameters.description: The apps virtual host settings, with multiple domains separated by commas. For example:        www.example.com, example.com

parameters.name: EnableSsl
parameters.description: Whether SSL is enabled for the app.

parameters.name: Environment
parameters.description: An array of EnvironmentVariable objects that specify environment variables to be      associated with the app. After you deploy the app, these variables are defined on the      associated app server instances.For more information, see  Environment Variables.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The app name.

parameters.name: SslConfiguration
parameters.description: An SslConfiguration object with the SSL configuration.

parameters.name: Type
parameters.description: The app type.

get.description: Updates a registered Elastic IP addresss name.

parameters.name: ElasticIp
parameters.description: The address.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The new name.

get.description: Updates a specified instance.

parameters.name: AgentVersion
parameters.description: The default AWS OpsWorks Stacks agent version. You have the following options:

parameters.name: AmiId
parameters.description: The ID of the AMI that was used to create the instance. The value of this parameter must be the same AMI ID that the instance is already using.           You cannot apply a new AMI to an instance by running UpdateInstance. UpdateInstance does not work on instances that are using custom AMIs.

parameters.name: Architecture
parameters.description: The instance architecture. Instance types do not necessarily support both architectures. For      a list of the architectures that are supported by the different instance types, see Instance        Families and Types.

parameters.name: AutoScalingType
parameters.description: For load-based or time-based instances, the type. Windows stacks can use only time-based instances.

parameters.name: EbsOptimized
parameters.description: This property cannot be updated.

parameters.name: Hostname
parameters.description: The instance host name.

parameters.name: InstallUpdatesOnBoot
parameters.description: Whether to install operating system and package updates when the instance boots. The default      value is true. To control when updates are installed, set this value to        false. You must then update your instances manually by using        CreateDeployment to run the update_dependencies stack command or      by manually running yum (Amazon Linux) or apt-get (Ubuntu) on the      instances.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The instance ID.

parameters.name: InstanceType
parameters.description: The instance type, such as t2.micro. For a list of supported instance types,      open the stack in the console, choose Instances, and choose + Instance.      The Size list contains the currently supported types. For more information, see Instance        Families and Types. The parameter values that you use to specify the various types are      in the API Name column of the Available Instance Types table.

parameters.name: LayerIds
parameters.description: The instances layer IDs.

parameters.name: Os
parameters.description: The instances operating system, which must be set to one of the following. You cannot update an instance that is using a custom AMI.

parameters.name: SshKeyName
parameters.description: The instances Amazon EC2 key name.

get.description: Updates a specified layer.

parameters.name: Attributes
parameters.description: One or more user-defined key/value pairs to be added to the stack attributes.

parameters.name: AutoAssignElasticIps
parameters.description: Whether to automatically assign an Elastic IP        address to the layers instances. For more information, see How to Edit        a Layer.

parameters.name: AutoAssignPublicIps
parameters.description: For stacks that are running in a VPC, whether to automatically assign a public IP address to      the layers instances. For more information, see How to Edit        a Layer.

parameters.name: CustomInstanceProfileArn
parameters.description: The ARN of an IAM profile to be used for all of the layers EC2 instances. For more      information about IAM ARNs, see Using      Identifiers.

parameters.name: CustomJson
parameters.description: A JSON-formatted string containing custom stack configuration and deployment attributes      to be installed on the layers instances. For more information, see              Using Custom JSON.

parameters.name: CustomRecipes
parameters.description: A LayerCustomRecipes object that specifies the layers custom recipes.

parameters.name: CustomSecurityGroupIds
parameters.description: An array containing the layers custom security group IDs.

parameters.name: EnableAutoHealing
parameters.description: Whether to disable auto healing for the layer.

parameters.name: InstallUpdatesOnBoot
parameters.description: Whether to install operating system and package updates when the instance boots. The default      value is true. To control when updates are installed, set this value to        false. You must then update your instances manually by using        CreateDeployment to run the update_dependencies stack command or      manually running yum (Amazon Linux) or apt-get (Ubuntu) on the      instances.

parameters.name: LayerId
parameters.description: The layer ID.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The layer name, which is used by the console.

parameters.name: Packages
parameters.description: An array of Package objects that describe the layers packages.

parameters.name: Shortname
parameters.description: For custom layers only, use this parameter to specify the layers short name, which is used internally by AWS OpsWorks Stacks and by Chef. The short name is also used as the name for the directory where your app files are installed. It can have a maximum of 200 characters and must be in the following format: /\A[a-z0-9\-\_\.]+\Z/.

parameters.name: UseEbsOptimizedInstances
parameters.description: Whether to use Amazon EBS-optimized instances.

parameters.name: VolumeConfigurations
parameters.description: A VolumeConfigurations object that describes the layers Amazon EBS volumes.

get.description: Updates a users SSH public key.

parameters.name: SshPublicKey
parameters.description: The users SSH public key.

get.description: Updates an Amazon RDS instance.

parameters.name: DbPassword
parameters.description: The database password.

parameters.name: DbUser
parameters.description: The master user name.

parameters.name: RdsDbInstanceArn
parameters.description: The Amazon RDS instances ARN.

get.description: Updates a specified stack.

parameters.name: AgentVersion
parameters.description: The default AWS OpsWorks Stacks agent version. You have the following options:

parameters.name: Attributes
parameters.description: One or more user-defined key-value pairs to be added to the stack attributes.

parameters.name: ChefConfiguration
parameters.description: A ChefConfiguration object that specifies whether to enable Berkshelf and the      Berkshelf version on Chef 11.10 stacks. For more information, see Create a New Stack.

parameters.name: ConfigurationManager
parameters.description: The configuration manager. When you update a stack, we recommend that you use the configuration manager to specify the Chef version: 12, 11.10, or 11.4 for Linux stacks, or 12.2 for Windows stacks. The default value for Linux stacks is currently 11.4.

parameters.name: CustomCookbooksSource
parameters.description: Contains the information required to retrieve an app or cookbook from a repository. For more      information, see Creating Apps or Custom Recipes and        Cookbooks.

parameters.name: CustomJson
parameters.description: A string that contains user-defined, custom JSON. It can be used to override the corresponding default stack configuration JSON values or to pass data to recipes. The string should be in the following format:

parameters.name: DefaultAvailabilityZone
parameters.description: The stacks default Availability Zone, which must be in the      stacks region. For more      information, see Regions and        Endpoints. If you also specify a value for DefaultSubnetId, the subnet must      be in the same zone. For more information, see CreateStack.

parameters.name: DefaultInstanceProfileArn
parameters.description: The ARN of an IAM profile that is the default profile for all of the stacks EC2 instances.      For more information about IAM ARNs, see Using      Identifiers.

parameters.name: DefaultOs
parameters.description: The stacks operating system, which must be set to one of the following:

parameters.name: DefaultRootDeviceType
parameters.description: The default root device type. This value is used by default for all instances in the stack,      but you can override it when you create an instance. For more information, see Storage for the Root Device.

parameters.name: DefaultSshKeyName
parameters.description: A default Amazon EC2 key-pair name. The default value is      none. If you specify a key-pair name,      AWS OpsWorks Stacks installs the public key on the instance and you can use the private key with an SSH      client to log in to the instance. For more information, see  Using SSH to        Communicate with an Instance and  Managing SSH        Access. You can override this setting by specifying a different key pair, or no key      pair, when you         create an instance.

parameters.name: DefaultSubnetId
parameters.description: The stacks default VPC subnet ID. This parameter is required if you specify a value for the        VpcId parameter. All instances are launched into this subnet unless you specify      otherwise when you create the instance. If you also specify a value for        DefaultAvailabilityZone, the subnet must be in that zone. For information on      default values and when this parameter is required, see the VpcId parameter      description.

parameters.name: HostnameTheme
parameters.description: The stacks new host name theme, with spaces replaced by underscores.      The theme is used to generate host names for the stacks instances.      By default, HostnameTheme is set to Layer_Dependent, which creates host names by appending integers to the      layers short name. The other themes are:

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The stacks new name.

parameters.name: ServiceRoleArn
parameters.description: Do not use this parameter. You cannot update a stacks service role.

parameters.name: StackId
parameters.description: The stack ID.

parameters.name: UseCustomCookbooks
parameters.description: Whether the stack uses custom cookbooks.

parameters.name: UseOpsworksSecurityGroups
parameters.description: Whether to associate the AWS OpsWorks Stacks built-in security groups with the stacks layers.

get.description: Updates a specified user profile.

parameters.name: AllowSelfManagement
parameters.description: Whether users can specify their own SSH public key through the My Settings page. For more      information, see Managing User        Permissions.

parameters.name: IamUserArn
parameters.description: The user IAM ARN. This can also be a federated users ARN.

parameters.name: SshPublicKey
parameters.description: The users new SSH public key.

parameters.name: SshUsername
parameters.description: The users SSH user name. The allowable characters are [a-z], [A-Z], [0-9], -, and _. If      the specified name includes other punctuation marks, AWS OpsWorks Stacks removes them. For example,        my.name will be changed to myname. If you do not specify an SSH      user name, AWS OpsWorks Stacks generates one from the IAM user name.

get.description: Updates an Amazon EBS volumes name or mount point.

parameters.name: MountPoint
parameters.description: The new mount point.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The new name.

parameters.name: VolumeId
parameters.description: The volume ID.
